DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluates the effect of ivabradine on endothelial function in patients with coronary artery disease (CAD) after complete revascularization with percutaneous coronary angioplasty (PCI). At least 30 days after PCI, patients will be randomized to receive ivabradine 5 mg twice daily or to continue with standard medical therapy.
DOC.brief_title: Ivabradine to Improve Endothelial Function in Patients With Coronary Artery Disease
DOC.criteria: history of stable coronary disease complete coronary revascularization with PCI at least 1 month prior to recruitment sinus rhythm absence of anginal symptoms resting heart rate <60 beats per minute severe reduction of left ventricle ejection fraction (<40%) coronary artery bypass surgery myocardial infarction, stroke or cerebral transient ischemic attack within the previous 6 months implanted pacemaker, cardioverter, or defibrillator sick sinus syndrome sinoatrial block congenital long QT complete atrioventricular block
